{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents provide evidence that breastfeeding can be used to alleviate procedural pain in neonates. For example, Document [0] states that breastfeeding had significantly less increase in the heart rate, reduced proportion of crying time and reduced duration of crying compared to the swaddled or pacifier group. Document [1] also supports this, stating that breastfeeding had a significantly lower increase in heart rate, reduced proportion of crying time and reduced duration of first cry and total crying time compared to other interventions. Document [3] also found that the lowest pain score was in the massage group, then in the breastfeeding group. Therefore, the evidence suggests that breastfeeding can be used to alleviate procedural pain in neonates.", "answer_choice": "A"}
